overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains a presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. While his LinkedIn has the largest follower base, engagement varies across platforms. His content is predominantly academic and professional, sharing research findings, conference presentations, and job opportunities.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to research projects, publications, and methodologies in computational social science.
Content focused on the study and detection of disinformation campaigns and coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media.
Posts about available research positions, PhD opportunities, and grant announcements.

recommendations: Diversify content types to include visual elements like infographics or short videos to increase engagement.
Engage more actively with followers by asking questions and responding to comments to foster a sense of community.
Tailor content to each platform's audience and best practices. For example, use relevant hashtags on Bluesky and Mastodon to increase visibility.
Consider running polls or surveys to gather audience feedback on research interests and content preferences.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows a good balance of research announcements and community engagement, with strong repost numbers. Focus on continuing to share research insights and engaging with relevant communities.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon content has a lower engagement rate compared to other platforms. Consider sharing more visually appealing content or participating in relevant conversations to increase visibility.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn performs well in terms of likes and comments, indicating a strong professional network. Continue to share announcements and job opportunities, and consider posting thought leadership pieces on relevant topics.
